content: Markets are currently revaluing software due to AI, as investors are concerned about the potential replacement of existing SaaS business models.

Significant selloffs in the market following the releases of Claude CoWork and Gemini have initiated discussions regarding seat-based pricing, inference costs, and enterprise adoption timelines for AI-driven software.

Analysts are divided on whether entrenched enterprise systems and distribution advantages will protect incumbent software companies from AI disruption, or if agent-enabled products will primarily disrupt weaker vendors and pricing models.
